items.description: River Thame, Horsenden Stream and Chalgrove Brook

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels are high on the River Thame as a result of sustained rainfall last week. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected today, 25 September 2023, especially in the Thame Bridge area. The weather forecast today is dry. Scattered showers are forecast tomorrow. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. 

Our staff are in the area clearing trash screens. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 

This message will be updated by this evening, 25 September 2023, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River levels remain high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water due to recent heavy rainfall and will remain so for several days.
Areas most at risk include The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. River levels also remain high at the Keswick Campsite; Lodore gauge.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 9:00am on 26/09/2023, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has now been removed. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Continue to take care on coastal roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.
